website_summaries.verdict: This ultra-popular unit impresses for its quality creations despite its affordable price tag.
pros: Lid constructed with large spout  to easily add ingredients
Makes ice cream in as little as 20 minutes
Machine lasts for years and comes with a 3-year warranty
cons: Does not make ice cream as smooth as other models

customer_reviews.title: Worked a few times and then started into a decline.  Terrible warranty.
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely dissatisfied with this product. When my unit broke after about ten, maybe fifteen uses, the company said that I would have to pay for shipping both ways to have it replaced. In the end, as another reviewer said, I will have to pay nearly as much for shipping as it would cost me to buy another one of these things. I think perhaps it might have been better to buy it at Bed Bath and Beyond, where I could just have returned it in the store. I am really disappointed with Cuisinart's warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Had this since July and now it sounds like a bucket of rocks tumbling. I think its done.
customer_reviews.author: paul d westerbeck

customer_reviews.title: Short product life expectancy
customer_reviews.text: In the last Couple of years I have purchased three of these machines and at least two replacement bowls. The gel in the bowls that freezes does not last. Very frustrating and has become very expensive. Makes great ice cream, but after my latest experience with a product failure at a small dinner gathering-- I am so done. In addition, I purchased two machines for family members as gifts and never received any feedback. I called them both and asked about their experiences. One machine lasted through only two sessions and the other through the hottest part of last summer. Come on Cuisinart--I feel ripped off and foolish.
customer_reviews.author: kenna morton

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I used this two times, third time, it would not turn the blade. I went to return it, and says the return expired--after only three months! Then, I read the one-star reviews and realized I fell into that category. The reviewers said it cost $10 to return, and another $10 for a new one to be shipped out. Very disappointing, as I trust Cuisinart as a brand, but not so much anymore... That was an awfully expensive 2 quarts of ice cream!!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Edwards

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: This machine is junk! All the recipes want you to mix ingredients in a blender and freeze overnight before you even put it in the machine. All it does is turn the bowl until the freezing component is completely melted ,, it never made anything frozen! I never even needed this thing , I just blended the ingredients and the froze them and I had my desert. A total waste of money! The paddles they give never even move. I don't know why they provide them. Plus the motor is very loud. It's going back!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware - Do Not Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Tried making ice cream today, appears the turning mechanism on the base is stripped out, it shudders.... Only 15 months old.. Maybe used five times... Amazon, what are you going to do..Still carry these... Cuisinart wanted $10 to ship each way to fix it... Think you need to re-evaluate carrying this item..
customer_reviews.author: Pepper

customer_reviews.title: Money wasted. Worked great first try
customer_reviews.text: Money wasted. Worked great first try. Second try, the gears locked up and it doesnt work. Of course i didnt make the second batch until after the 30 day window for a refund had passed.
customer_reviews.author: MDagos

customer_reviews.title: Could have been good if propery engineered.
customer_reviews.text: I would love to say this is a great product, however it only worked for 1 & 1/2 batches of ice cream before the motor sounded like it was auditioning for a monster movie and could not exert enough force to spin the canister properly. Its unfortunate that they went cheap on the motor. So be aware if you let your ice cream get to think you may be in for an unpleasant surprise. I am promptly returning this model and looking for something with a little more lasting power.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Wood

customer_reviews.title: I don't know why this happened as it worked fine the first 2 times and I never put any ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this twice and when I tried to use it a third time it broke and the stirring mechanism got stuck and wouldn't shift at all. I don't know why this happened as it worked fine the first 2 times and I never put any parts of it in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Lactose intolerant daughter is thrilled!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh. This far exceeded my expectations! My daughter is severely lactose intolerant so I bought this for her to have more ice cream options. So impressed with this ice cream maker! Super easy to make and ice cream tastes delicious! Definitely recommend getting the Ben and Jerry's recipe book and containers to go along with your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Beau  Rollins

customer_reviews.title: Great for keto ice cream!
customer_reviews.text: Works great as long as freezer bowl is completely frozen. Is a great addition to a keto diet! 2 cups heavy cream 1 can coconut milk 2 Tbs of stevia 2 Tbs vanilla Any other flavor additions (Cacao, strawberries, matcha powder)
customer_reviews.author: Brian VanderElzen

customer_reviews.title: A TERRIBLY CHEAP & CHEESY PIECE OF LIGHTWEIGHT PLASTIC RUBBISH!  SHAME ON YOU CUISINART!
customer_reviews.text: I don't even know where to begin on this piece of junk! The entire appliance (everything in it or on it!), is made of ridiculously lightweight plastic, even the drive gear and the internal paddle! The tub itself didn't fit snugly over the plastic gear drive, so it wobbled when spinning, the clear plastic cover didn't latch securely, etc., etc. I could go on for days! I literally couldn't believe my eyes when I unpacked it. Just plain 'ol trash! Its shameful that Amazon is selling such garbage and even more shameful that Cuisinart chose to put their name on it! This one did it for me - I'm flat-out DONE with Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: This ice cream maker is really nice. It takes about 20 minutes to create the ...
customer_reviews.text: This ice cream maker is really nice. It takes about 20 minutes to create the ice cream and then needs another 20 in the freezer. It is important to have a very cold freezer. The reach in freezer on top of our refrigerator wasn't cold enough and we thought the product didn't work right and we were disappointed. We read online that other people had experienced the same thing, but once they got the canister cold enough it worked great. It is super easy to clean and looks cute on the counter. We use it 2 or 3 times a week. Makes the hot hot summer here just a little more bearable.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Turn it on BEFORE you add the ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these before and thought I knew everything about it. What I hadn't done was read the directions and made the mistake of pouring the ingredients into the machine before turning it on. The result was not good. The sides of the tub will freeze the ingredients almost immediately and the plastic hood will not latch. Don't do what I did. It made a horrible mess and I had to remove the semi frozen ice cream and defrost the entire tub and start all over again.
customer_reviews.author: Saltwater Diva

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. Cuisinart is shipping defective drums.
customer_reviews.text: There is a freezable drum that this product depends on. When not frozen and you shake the drum it sounds like water is in it per other reviews. When frozen it doesn't make a sound per other reviews. The defective ones sound like pieces of plastic are in the drum per me. Those drums will not freeze per me. Exposing the drum to high heat like in a dishwasher will make the drum ineffective per other reviews. Both units sent to me were defective out of the box per me.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Half and half
customer_reviews.text: Love the spout for adding ingredients. Love not having to use ice and salt. I hate that the metal bowl is too cold to hold when scraping out the ice cream and you can't scrape it all out because it freezes to the sides. You can't clean it until it thaws out because the water freezes inside too. I wish there was a liner to pull out and the bowl just went back in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: NO INSTRUCTION BOOK, recipe book, proof of purchase!!! 🤨😤😤😤
customer_reviews.text: Hard to estimate how to use it being NO INSTRUCTIONS OR RECIPES WERE IN MY BOX!😫😤😠😠😩so im upset about that, 1st off! I have no way of proving I have a warranty too!! Im very disgusted today after opening up box for 1st time, buying separate frzr bowl to keep in frzr. Was ready to make 1st batch tonite but NO INFO NO RECIPES SO.... NO ICE CREAM TONITE!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Plan 24 hours to make ice cream
customer_reviews.text: Ice cream came out good As far as taste, but now all the bad things- what we did not care for about this, you have to freeze the container for several hours before you can even use it And then freeze the ice cream afterwards was not as expected cannot make ice cream quickly secondly the container is so small we can make inly a very small amount of ice cream at a time enough for one person-
customer_reviews.author: Williams

customer_reviews.title: The short lived love story
customer_reviews.text: If you've ever had a scoop of ice cream fall of the cone and land in the dirt then you understand my love but now I'm sad relationship with this ice cream maker. A dozen uses and the motor is going clunk clunk and no longer has enough power to make my perfected ice cream recipe. I thought I'll go buy another but why would I put more money into another Cuisinart ice cream maker. Well, I won't. I'm disappointed in the cheap quality of this Cuisinart small appliance, keep looking now or you will be later anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi Mae

customer_reviews.title: better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I like a bit of icecream now and then but the supermarket kind has a slimy texture from gum preservatives that I do not care fore. Thought I would give this a try. It works great. I have a fridge that comes with the apartment-nothing fancy, has a freezer compartment on the top. The bowl got frozen --the vanilla recipe from the manual came out fine--nice and thick in less than 15 minutes. I did not have cream, so used half and half. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Vic

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS IT
customer_reviews.text: I have had a few ice cream makers over the years . Price wise it can’t be beat . Great technology as the cylinder turns not the blade the old way blade would get stuck . Also the cruisinart recipe book is tested and true makes perfect amount , do not add to it unless you subtract . The strawberry recipe makes a little less than 3 pints. It’s so easy my emotionally disturbed son Augie can do it , he calls his adapted vanilla w chocolate chips and Cheeries “BIG BOY “
customer_reviews.author: twelvepaws

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I have used my ice cream maker twice now. Sadly it does not work. I followed the directions completely. I put the bowl in the freezer for 24 hours. It started getting thick and then the machine got so hot it melted everything. I have had to pour the ice cream into a separate container and put it in the freezer both times. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M. Easley

customer_reviews.title: Makes great Coconut milk or almond milk ice cream
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize making ice cream could be so easy. 1. Just throw banana, strawberry, mongoes, melon, or any other fruit into a food processor, pour coconut milk or almond milk, turn on the food processor for a dozen seconds; 2. Turn on the Ice cream maker; 3. pour the milk-fruit mixture into the ice cream maker; 4. Enjoy your home made ice cream in about 15 minutes. No need to add cream. Banana gives your ice cream creaminess.
customer_reviews.author: Morning star

customer_reviews.title: Ice cream maker
customer_reviews.text: Find a good recipe, freeze the thing for 24 hrs start spinning it FIRST then put in your ingredients and you have ice cream in like 20 minutes it is as simple as that!
customer_reviews.author: GadgetGuruClubDotCom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ice cream maker!
customer_reviews.text: I got this item to make frozen keifer ice cream. If you follow the directions in the instruction booklet, you will have no problems at all. I got a recipe online. Don't forget to put the bowl in the freezer for 24 hours. I just keep mine in there when not using it. Mix your ingredients, take the bowl out of the freezer, put the paddle in it, the clear plastic lid on (make sure it clicks down all the way) and turn it on and then pour your ingredients into the bowl while it is turning (its all in the instructions) Leave it churning until desired consistency, and its done! Mine took 20 minutes. It is so easy!
customer_reviews.author: deborah

customer_reviews.title: Hate it
customer_reviews.text: The mixture sticks to the sides of the bowl and freezes solid, unable to eat that part, the rest is very soft serve and melts to quickly. I have tried to like this machine, but I just don't like working with it. The old fashion churn machines are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality. And seller does not return email for ...
customer_reviews.text: it broke after first use. Do not buy this product. Not good quality. And seller does not return email for a refund .
customer_reviews.author: Michelle MacGaffey Alvis

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew who wanted an ice cream maker for Christmas and I helped him make his first. It’s easy to use and comes out great. It has a consistency of frozen yogurt after it’s done in the machine. You are suppose to put it in the freezer for some time to let it become harder either way it’s delicious! Growing up I had the big tub that you filled with ice this one on the other hand comes with it’s own “ice pack like tub” that you pre-freeze over night to use before making it. You won’t need a ton of ice just some preparation.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: I love ice cream
customer_reviews.text: Been wanting to do this for years. The machine is great and I have a garage freezer so getting it cold and keeping it level is easy. Note to new ice cream makers, use more flavor and sugar/sweetener than you think you need. Cold food doesn’t taste sweet without the “extra”.
customer_reviews.author: Billie

customer_reviews.title: Weak motor lead to no ice cream. :-(
customer_reviews.text: I thought the name Cuisinart gave it some quality by it's brand, but I was sorely mistaken. My issue, as has been noted by other reviewers, is the weak motor. Once the ice cream starts to solidify, it no longer churns. It either just spins around in a blob in the middle or it stops spinning all together. The waffle maker we bought at the same time works great, so maybe Cuisinart hasn't completely gone to pot.
customer_reviews.author: Just havin fun

customer_reviews.title: Makes good ice cream until it doesn’t.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this machine for a few years, and when it works, it makes terrific ice cream. My biggest struggle has been keeping a functional freezer bowl. A broken seal on the bowl means it won’t freeze the ice cream properly. The first time, my husband broke the seal by putting it in the dishwasher. Since then we have been very careful about cleaning it with cool water and storing it upright in the freezer, but the freezer bowls just never seem to last. Since the replacement bowls cost nearly as much as the original unit, this is actually a pretty huge downside.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ekar

customer_reviews.title: Makes sure it’s not refurbished
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived very late and did not work properly. The bowl did not spin and I was left with a big mess of liquid ice cream. When I looked at the manual it said “refurbished.” I had no idea I had purchased something that was not new. I called Cusinart and after being on hold for almost an hour they said they would send me a brand new one in 3 weeks! Maybe I’ll get it by 4th of July. Very bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Not working after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: Worked 2 times. Cuisinart is sending a replacement, but I have to pay $10 for shipping. This is my 1st Cuisinart and it will be my last
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Love it: Easy to Use, Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when my husband ordered this ice cream maker, but we love it! Unlike traditional ice cream makers it is very quick and easy (about 10 minutes) to whip up batches (6 small servings). We find a 1 cup milk, 1 cup heavy cream, and 1/2 cup sugar to be the best basic recipe ratio. (If you leave out sugar it will freeze too hard instead of keeping a creamy texture). We have fun mixing in all kinds of flavor extracts, toppings, and fruits.
customer_reviews.author: Ruston

customer_reviews.title: Terrific homemade ice cream made easy
customer_reviews.text: It's noisy when running (thus a 1 star deduction), but so easy to use, and there are so many recipes on the web that one can never run out of options. HOWEVER, just be aware that you will be buying more and more ice cream storage containers, and you will have to buy another freezer just for ice cream, and you will be solely supporting dairies, and you will gain lots of weight and get diabetes and hypertension and your sinuses will freeze! Because --- ICE CREAM!
customer_reviews.author: Tholos

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love this machine...
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get my ice cream maker. I eat ice cream just about every night and wanted to make my own without chemicals or additives. I researched forever before deciding on this one. I did exactly as the instructions said (and tips I read from reviews and online sources). But, alas, the ice cream is like soup. It's barely soft serve consistency, more like a thin milkshake. I've tried everything, thinking it was operator error. I altered the mix, adding less milk and more cream, more sugar, less sugar, made sure the mix was very cold and the bowl was completely frozen. Still, not ice cream. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Perry

customer_reviews.title: Easy - Fast - Deliciously Creamy
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Ice Cream Maker. I had a Kitchen Aid ice cream attachment maker and it NEVER EVER made decent ice cream. Really for me it was a waste of money. I read the reviews on this machine and decided to give it a try. OMG - first time I used the simple fresh strawberry recipe in the booklet and it turned out absolutely fantastic. Firm, creamy and fast. We had perfect ice cream within around 20 minutes. What a great find. I can't believe it has taken me all these years to realize there was an easy and inexpensive machine that would make a few simple ingredients turn into something so decadent.
customer_reviews.author: C. Warner

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Worst mixing ever. Only the bowl moves around, not the paddles. So 10 min into a 20min turning time all the ice cream was just stuck to the inside "paddles" and not being turned at all. All our ice cream when put in the freezer becomes an ice cube because it isn't turned enough. HUGE disappointment. Would not ever recommend.
customer_reviews.author: arianna

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I made tangerine sorbet and it was done so fast. I've always wanted an ice cream maker because I loooove ice cream but didn't think the machine was worth it. Let me tell you, IT IS WORTH IT. More than satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Naty_in_Wonderland

customer_reviews.title: Super happy with this!
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this!! Just got it. Just used it. Reasonably quiet, really churns the ice cream. I’m particularly happy with this because the last one I had left a thick coat of ice cream around the freezer bowl, wasting half of what I made. This one really scrapes the bowl, leaving only a very thin layer on the bowl. I made frozen no fat Greek yougurt. It was done in less than twenty minutes, with a creamy mouth feel like Haagen Daz for half the calories!! I did have to move the freezer bowl from the front of my freezer to the back to get it to freeze solidly, but after that—piece of cake!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy! This is our second one unit. Summer fruits and ices!
customer_reviews.text: Originally thought I would purchase another bowl instead of this unit. It didn't make sense. The entire unit was $15 more than just purchasing the bowl alone. With my luck the motor of our current cusinart would stop working, so we decided to purchase the entire unit. If you have the space, it is worth paying the $15 more for a entire unit. Love making ice cream with this simple gadget. Make sure the machine is on and turning before adding in your ice cream mixture or you can break the blades. DO NOT POUR IN THE MIXTURE and then turn it on.
customer_reviews.author: Aunty Char

customer_reviews.title: Will get charged if you don’t like this item
customer_reviews.text: Too noisy. Worst of all when I went to return I got charged even though it should have been free since I am a prime member. No where did it mention a charge would be incurred if I were to return
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loving it.
customer_reviews.text: Despite the fact that it is currently 21 degrees outside, had to try the new ice cream machine. Started with the simple chocolate ice cream recipe. That was easy enough. Machine did get louder as the ice cream became thicker. But not that bad; just the last 5 or 6 minutes. After 15 minutes, had absolutely delicious and creamy soft serve ice cream; just the way we like it. I was surprised with the volume of ice cream we ended up with too. Plenty of leftover for the freezer. I used stevia and powdered milk instead of whole milk.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great and Made Great Ice Cream
customer_reviews.text: Received this yesterday, washed the freezer tub and mixing paddle, put the tub in the freezer for 24 hours and made the simple vanilla recipe exactly as it in the instruction booklet. After refrigerating the mix for a couple of hours I took the tub out of the freezer, installed it and the paddle, turned it on and poured the mix in the top. within 15 minutes I had a well frozen ice cream. If those who have trouble with this would follow instructions and make sure their freezer is 0 degrees they should have no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Randy G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfection! SUGAR FREE FRIENDLY!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this a handful of times now, and each time it makes amazing frozen yogurt. My mom is pre-diabetic so we make ALL our frozen yogurt sugar free. It takes a little adjustment, and doesn’t freeze as well but it’s so delicious, and gets rid of that ice cream craving! With sugar free, you just have to eat it all right away. Refreezing in the freezer makes the sugar free stuff as hard as a block of ice. You CAN microwave the block for about 15 seconds and that helps but it’s just better to go right ahead and eat it all! Good excuse to occasionally pig out! 😝
customer_reviews.author: MKelly

customer_reviews.title: Huston we have a problem with the ice creram maker
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this ice cream maker after all it was a Cusinart and got some good review from other users. The problem is that it's not engineered well. The paddle inside the frozen tub is supposed to scrap the ice-cream off the tub wall and back into the center but as the ice-cream hardened it did so unevenly, solid on the walls and liquid in the center of the tub. When this happened the paddle stopped doing it's job and began spinning with the tub. Anyway I had to send it back for not working.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Engelson

customer_reviews.title: Nice little ice cream maker
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product late summer of 2017. I didn't realize how much I would like making ice cream. It also comes with a recipe book which I use. The machine works great but is a little noisy. The liquid in the ice cream bowl stopped freezing last week. I am very conscious about following the care instructions for it. I called customer service. My warranty was still in place and they are sending me a replacement bowl. So I would also say their customer service is also above average.
customer_reviews.author: Carol J

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Though you will not get the exact texture from store bought ice cream (because you're not adding gum to it), this is by far some of the best ice cream I've had. I made a no sugar added dark chocolate ice cream and let some family sample it. I didn't tell them it was no sugar added. They loved it and was surprised to find that it was no sugar added. I now make all my ice creams with no sugar (except what is already in the ingredients) and love every bite. In fact, I think I'll go get a cup of freshly picked strawberry ice cream (no sugar added).
customer_reviews.author: 13th Floor Stories

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: So I'm really not lazy, but I had thought and hoped that you poured all of the ingredients into the bowl, turn on and mix and freeze and you're done. Instead, you have to first mix all of the ingredients with a hand mixer, freeze and then blend with this. Much easier and cheaper to just buy some quality ice cream and put your efforts into making great a great topping. Unfortunately we didn't keep the box so now it's just taking up space in my pantry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bowl no longer freezes mixture.....disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with the freezer at first but as time passes, the bowl did not freeze the milk mixture....less and less with each use. I have tried chilling ingredients, freezing the bowl after completely thawed for days or a week but today was a total disappointment...no freezing occurred at all. I won't waste my money again. Good idea but something really wrong with the gel breaking down.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great ice cream maker
customer_reviews.text: This couldn't be simpler - you mix together some ingredients (which can be simple or complex depending on your recipe), assemble the 4 part machine, hit the power button, and pour the mix into the drum. Only caveat - drum needs to be frozen solid (~ 8-12 hours) to work. We've tried recipes with egg and without. We've tried recipes that are simmered and cooled and we've tried some you just mix and dump. The 1.5 qt is a great size for most any family. The unit is easily to clean. We may buy an extra drum so we always have 1 ready to go. Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Tuchscherer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine for the money
customer_reviews.text: I'd been wanting an ice cream maker that doesn't require ice, isn't loud, and cost less than $100. This one totally fit the bill. It makes about 1.5 quarts, which is almost 3 pints. But....don't think you can put 3 pints of batter into it, because then you'll get a mess. A bunch of yummy soft serve, but then also a mess. This machine is very easy to use and set up. It took less than 20 minutes to freeze (from refrigerated batter) and everything comes apart easily for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Wednesday Lee Friday

customer_reviews.title: Need to get to know it and will it last?
customer_reviews.text: I have successfully made three types of deserts in the machine. I like the simplicity, however, there is a learning curve regarding what kind of desert you are making and how much can “Fit” in the bowl. Different % of cream for instance results in more volume increase and possible overflow. Also, depending on ingredients, churning times vary a bit. I have no issue with the learning curve however. What I am concerned with is longevity. It has plastic gears and a plastic paddle. How long will it last? I will revisit after a year.
customer_reviews.author: nemo's dogs

customer_reviews.title: great machine
customer_reviews.text: works well, makes real, creamy ice-cream. My kids love it. Only thing is the bucket can only be used for one batch at a time(as others have said), and needs to be completely frozen first. We thought the bucket still felt frozen and tried for second batch of ice cream but it was not frozen enough. My kids really love watching it turn into real ice-cream within twenty minutes. Great price for what it is!!
customer_reviews.author: S.D.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved the ice cream maker. Ready to eat ice cream in 20 minutes. However, the last time I used it the ice cream maker it did not set as it churned.. I thought it was user error and maybe the ice cream makers container was not cold enough even though I did not hear liquid swishing around when I shook it prior to use. Today.I used the ice cream maker again after keeping it in the freezer for one week and had the same issue. I followed all the instructions but it failed to set. I am greatly disappointed that it broke so soon.
customer_reviews.author: Anu

customer_reviews.title: This product doesn't work properly.
customer_reviews.text: Sides and insert (where spinner goes into) freezes up and there for no spinning. Need spinning to make frozen yogurt.
customer_reviews.author: Enid

customer_reviews.title: Ice Cream at home!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to try lots of different recipes at home. My kids love ice cream, and they love helping with this easy to use ice cream maker. Comes with a great recipe book, with lots of flavors to try. This won’t make creamery quality silky smooth ice cream, but it does a great job, and is able to make any flavor you can think of. Lots of fun with the family!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea making ice cream was so easy! I love this machine. I keep the inside liner in the freezer all the time so I can make ice cream whenever the urge strikes me. It does not make a large amount of ice cream (four smallish servings) but is perfect for single person or couple. If you have children, you may opt for a larger size. If your ingredients are cold to begin with, you can be eating ice cream in an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Zee Lugo

customer_reviews.title: My first ice cream maker
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned an ice cream maker before so can't compare it to others, but, I'm very happy with the product and the ice cream it produces. It's a bit of a pain to have to freeze the bowl for hours, but a little advanced planning can help with that. I love that I can create ice cream just the way I like it. It may not have all the bells and whistles of some other ice cream makers, but it's reasonably priced and does the job it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bogin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product
customer_reviews.text: Well I just got this two days ago and my first use and it doesn't lock, makes a horrible bumping sound because of that. I followed the instructions to a T. The knobs that are to lock it into position don't appear to be thick enough. Right now I have the clear plastic cover off in hopes the mixture will form into something edible! What a waist of money, product, mixture and freezing tray purchased for ice cream. Hopefully hubby didn't bur the return box! So very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Minniepearl1

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you follow this one simple rule!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and clean. Quantity is a little small for a family, I could use a bigger container. Make sure you always have the machine running before you start pouring your ice cream mix into it! If you don't do that and end up with frozen mix that interferes with the machine operation - stop the machine and was the container with warm water until it's 100% clean. Otherwise, you're risking jamming the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Gil S

customer_reviews.title: We can easily spend $25 at our local ice cream parlor so ...
customer_reviews.text: We can easily spend $25 at our local ice cream parlor so $40 on this machine was completely worth it. It's so easy to use. DO follow the directions it comes with. I froze the bowl overnight. We have only used it to make Dole whips from a commercially prepared mix but they are top notch, as good as Disney. My kids were eating it out of the top before it was even done. The machine could not be more simple. As for the noise it makes? It is comparable to a low vacuum cleaner. Nothing crazy.
customer_reviews.author: michael aboagye

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean, but needs a few tries to figure out
customer_reviews.text: Need to work out the kinks to understand how your freezer works for the cold bowl. I have a freezer in my garage and it took about 12 hours to get the bowl to the right level in order to make the ice cream properly. My first go around I stored it for 8 hours and then the second go around for 14 hours. The first time left the cream in a liquid state while the second time made ice cream within 14 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: km_wondering

customer_reviews.title: I love this ice cream maker! Best thing I ever bought for myself!
customer_reviews.text: I’m on keto diet and this is the best thing I ever bought to help me with my ice cream cravings. I lost 42 lbs within 6 months and maintaining the diet is the hardest part because there’s temptations everywhere. Having this ice cream maker at home made it so easy for me to make my own low carb and sugar free ice cream. It makes enough serving for my family. It’s easy to clean and very durable. I will buy it again and I highly recommend this product to my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on March 19, 2019 The bucket cracked on March 14, 2020 ‌Easy to use but didn't freeze very well. The bucket cracked while in process of making ice cream after using this product less than 10 times. The price for replacement about the same with a brand new!! Well.....No, Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: The only downside is that you must freeze the tub in advance. Luckily we have plenty of freezer space. Otherwise, you may need to plan long in advance of using. Much easier and less messy than using ice and rock salt.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy J. Buske

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment - made excellent ice cream almost half a dozen ...
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment - made excellent ice cream almost half a dozen times before the engine burned out. Followed directions and everything. Oh, well. My cholesterol levels will probably thank me. Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sybil Mcguire

customer_reviews.title: just Maple syrup and my kids love it, can't get enough of it
customer_reviews.text: Homemade ice cream - yes! I make it with the receipe found in Nourishing Traditions: The Cookbook that Challenges Politically Correct Nutrition and Diet Dictocrats from Sally, so no sugar, just Maple syrup and my kids love it, can't get enough of it! I would say it's fairly easy to make home made ice cream, but it's not idiot proof ( you do need to get the timing right). Which explains some of the bad reviews on this ice cream maker. ;)
customer_reviews.author: A. Labrooy

customer_reviews.title: Makes ice cream as good as the units that cost 2x 3x more
customer_reviews.text: I just made a batch of Dole Whip in this unit. If you don't know what that is it's the tasty treat that people stand in line for at DisneyLand. It came out perfectly. I love this unit. No muss, no fuss, no salt, no sore arms. You just toss the base unit in your freezer overnight and you're ready for a cool summer treat in 20/25 minutes. You can use any ice cream or sherbet recipe you like best. It does them all. I love this.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Used Once and Broken!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed! We used the ice cream maker once and it was fantastic! We followed the recipe and instructions that come with the booklet. 2 days later we go to repeat our process and the ice cream doesn't harden. It just churns and churns in the ice cream maker and never changes consistency. The base started to get very hot, which I am assuming prevented the ice cream from getting cold enough and hardening. I read some review which said this worked once and then broke. I'm so sad!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Emma Paris

customer_reviews.title: I contacted Amazon and they replaced it within days and the second one has worked fine. My daughter has the exact same brand/mod
customer_reviews.text: The first one I purchased broke after the second use. I think it was the (plastic) gears inside. I contacted Amazon and they replaced it within days and the second one has worked fine. My daughter has the exact same brand/model and she is very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to store-bought ice-cream
customer_reviews.text: I saw this machine in action and was amazed at how easy it is to make my own ice cream. With allergies at home - felt making my own was a much better way to go. Did not like how the packaging was handled - did contact Amazon on that and they took accountability. The machine works awesome! The ice cream is superior quality - I use organic creamer, goat's milk, almond cream, organic sugar, vanilla and salt. Even with the better quality ingredients, still come out ahead with cost. Was paying $6 for pint of almond milk ice cream with tons of ingredients I could not pronounce. Very happy! And the family is enjoying the ice cream very much.
customer_reviews.author: Solange Pilizota

customer_reviews.title: Does not freeze properly!
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for this ice cream maker. Have made 4 batches of various ice cream flavors. The ice cream never freezes properly. It never even freezes to a soft serve stage. End up pouring mix into container and then freezing in my freezer. This leaves the ice cream with little ice crystals in it. Still tasty but not smooth. I followed directions accurately. So don't believe this is operator error. Will try to return to Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well. No need for messy rock salt.
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. It makes ice cream without the need for messy rock salt. The end product will come out pretty soft, but nothing an hour in the freezer can't fix. Tip: Chill a container in the freezer an hour before starting the ice cream. Once the ice cream is done, transfer it to the chilled container. Since it's chilled, it won't melt the ice cream. Put the container in the freezer for as long as it takes to get the consistency you like.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Beal

customer_reviews.title: Just fine with splenda + lowfat dairy products
customer_reviews.text: Great product probably not needing another review. I was reluctant to buy it because some other reviews stated there has to be sugar in the mix for a texture. For anyone with the same doubts - it works just fine without sugar/whole milk/heavy cream or whatever else calorie booster you do not want in your ice cream. Splenda + 2% evaporated milk + banana/mango/vanilla powder works just fine. It might be a little too hard if left in the freezer overnight, never had it last that long though :)
customer_reviews.author: notsunami

customer_reviews.title: I try and keep it low sugar and this machine works great. Its small enough to fit in my freezer ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this often to make my own ice cream. I am a type 1 diabetic and I measure most of my ingredients. I try and keep it low sugar and this machine works great. Its small enough to fit in my freezer but big enough to make a few servings. If you have a large family I would recommend getting a larger one. So far this has worked as claimed and everything has tasted great!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Very fun and yummy for the family
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ice cream maker. It is very easy to use and easy to clean. It comes with some useful recipes and it is fun to change up the flavors. It makes a decent amount of ice cream and I think it’s perfect for our family of three. You might need something bigger if you have a larger group that you are serving. The pieces fit together nicely so it doesn’t take up a lot of space when storing. But you do have to remember to put the bowl in the freezer for a while before you want to make the ice cream.
customer_reviews.author: Kriston

customer_reviews.title: My favorite self-indulgent appliance!
customer_reviews.text: This ice-cream maker is easy to use and works beautifully. What a treat to make our own gourmet ice creams at home-- though calorically dangerous! In spite of the extra preparation time and calories, I recommend the custard-style ice cream recipes that are in the user guide/ recipe book included with the machine. I've already been thinking of new recipes beyond the handful provided. Each batch produces about 2.5 pints of ice cream, so it's not enough for a crowd unless you have a few days to stockpile multiple batches.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Lynch

customer_reviews.title: I love this ice cream maker!!
customer_reviews.text: I follow a Keto lifestyle and I love ice cream. I decided to buy myself an ice cream maker so I know that only clean ingredients will be used. This ice cream make is pretty fantastic. I’ve made ice cream numerous times in the few months I’ve purchased it. I’ve only ventured to make butter pecan from the little recipe booklet/instructions. I tend to just stick with either chocolate or vanilla cause it tastes so darn good plain. Highly highly recommend. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Boxinghelena

customer_reviews.title: Not worthy.Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible!I did my vanilla basic ice cream and after 30 minutes it is still liquid.The machine is noisy.The cord is too short.
customer_reviews.author: Victor H.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: The issue with this product is you can never get the ice cream to get to ice cream , it stays in a milkshake form or less. I looked up online and a lot of people have the same issue , I’m returning mine but if you chose to buy it try the tip I got which was to freeze the mixture for about 30 minutes before putting it into to maker so it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia wagner

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to make my own ice cream for years but could never justify buying an ice cream maker. I have been craving devon stout ice-cream ( very popular in my home country, Jamaica) so I decided to go ahead and invest. Works very well. I froze the bowl for 24 hours and then added my stout mixture and 20 minutes later I had the best tasting ice cream I have every had. Washed the bowl and place it back into my freezer for next time. So cool!
customer_reviews.author: Kwatson

customer_reviews.title: Sorbet freak
customer_reviews.text: Love this ice cream maker. Super easy to use, clean and we make ice cream at least once a week in it. Disclaimer I still think you have to freeze the ice cream before you can eat. It's just too soft out of the container but I don't mind waiting. I'm saving money from the runs to the grocery store at 8 pm for a 6$ pint of ice cream and my hips thank me. Super recommend trying sorbet and avocado ice cream. It's impossible to gorge. As always I did hours of research and this was just the best out there and cheap as all get out. Really great to add for family bonding time
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for the sole purpose of making 'KETO' ice cream. You have to store the 'cooling component' in the freezer for 24 hours before you make your ice cream, but when that time is up, you can make ice cream in a snap. It beats the old days of hand cranked ice cream constantly feeding the machine ice as you went. I would recommend this for the quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Owens

customer_reviews.title: I love the machine...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this ice cream maker its perfect for me. It is not too big and stores easy. Its easy to use, works well and easy to clean. My only downfall is I have tried 2 or 3 of the recipes it gives and they have not been very good so I highly do not recommend the recipes they give. The last couple times i've used it I used online recipes and they have come out AMAZING so if you are going to make ice cream use different recipes than they give you. In conclusion love this.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: When life hands you a pandemic, make ice cream
customer_reviews.text: This ice cream maker paid for itself and then some. Since going to the store is difficult and finding the flavors you want even more challenging, we started making our own. Super easy recipes in the booklet... we just added various ingredients and flavorings. We have enjoyed every bite. Just wish it was easier to scoop the ice cream out once mixed.
customer_reviews.author: OC Momma

customer_reviews.title: I scream, you scream, we all love ICE CREAM!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I just tasted my first batch of salted caramel ice cream and my taste buds danced with delight! This machine is by far the easiest of ALL my kitchen appliances both to operate and clean. I have other Cuisinart products and therefore knew they are high-quality and very dependable. I chose this unit based on Amazon reviews and also those of numerous cooking and recipe sites. I will never buy ice cream from the store or specialty shops again, since I can make from scratch and know exactly what is in the recipe. Can't wait to make a lemon sorbet!
customer_reviews.author: sirius1nWA

customer_reviews.title: Good Ice Cream
customer_reviews.text: This works well- makes awesome ice cream and is simple to use. Unfortunately, I froze the bowl with a little water in it, which created a chunk of hidden ice that broke the paddle on the 3rd use. Check the bowl when you pull it out of the freezer to make sure there are no ice chunks before you blend. I will order replacement from Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah DuFresne

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good
customer_reviews.text: You need freezer space for the large canister. Only one quart+ at a time. Loses freeze quickly when you start churning so refrigerate ice cream base before using. Easy to use and clean. Soft freeze improves after putting into containers and freezing for 4 hours. Easy to use and clean. Have made good ice cream using Jeni’s Spendid Ice Creams Recipes
customer_reviews.author: b from havertown

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty and it works.
customer_reviews.text: This ice cream maker is a beautiful shade of deep red. I love it. I have only used it once, so I can’t speak to its durability, but it worked really quickly the first time. In fact, it worked so well, that my ice cream froze much quicker than the recipe anticipated which got the churner stuck and the motor shut off to prevent overheating. That’s a great feature, since I had walked away with my kitchen timer, not expecting it to be ready for several more minutes. It makes the perfect amount of ice cream for a once-in-a-while treat for the family. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Trixie J Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Great ice cream maker!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to make small batches of frozen yogurt and this does the trick. I leave the bowl in the freezer so it's ready to go whenever I want. Takes only 15-20 minutes and it's done. Scoop our into my Sumo ice cream storage container (another recommendation). Wash by hand and leave the bowl out until it's totally defrosted. Then back into the freezer it goes to be ready for the next time. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm2

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use, comes with great instructions and recipes. I've had it for about two months now. Have made two batches fruit sorbets using different frozen fruit mixes. Have made vanilla ice cream, chocolate, chocolate chip, mocha, and coffee. Invest in vanilla beans, you will be glad you did. I love knowing exactly what ingredients are going into my sorbet or ice cream.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Santoro

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Where are these people getting this ice cream from? I froze the bowl in a zero degree freezer. Half froze the mixture. Poured it into the device and after 20 minutes it is no more frozen then when I poured the mixture in. Complete wast of money.
customer_reviews.author: D. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Why did we wait so long..
customer_reviews.text: We made our first recipe of Keto Chocolate Peanut Butter with Chocolate Chips Ice Cream. It turned out awesome. In 15 minutes we had a delicious treat. The machine is very easy to set up and use. It was simple to clean as well. We are looking forward to discovering varied recipes and variations. Perfect sized ice cream maker.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Fox

customer_reviews.title: hasnt let me down yet
customer_reviews.text: and i make icecream all the time. very lovely texture, so easy to use and clean and so cute. Amazing deal for the money. Just keep the round container in the freezer all the time for ready use. I keep other frozen things inside it so doesnt take up too much space.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Homemade Keto Ice Cream - Yay!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, who knew I’d actually use yet another kitchen electric?! But wow, I can have ice cream again for the first time in a year’s worth of being on a pretty restricted diet - I can make Keto, sugar-free ice cream- yum! I planned to purchase the KitchenAid attachment, but after reading the blue-goo reviews, I decided on this one - easy to clean, easy to use, perfect for the 2 of us, even have leftovers for another night - I might upgrade to the larger size if we were a larger fam - in any case, exceeded expectations, and have made room for it on the counter - for the summer, at least!
customer_reviews.author: Raibabe03

customer_reviews.title: Made good batch the first time, but....
customer_reviews.text: Power switch broken after the first use. Loaded frozen bowl for the second batch a week later and nothing. No resistance, no contact, switch just moves and nothing. Most expensive Coconut ice cream I've ever had at $39.99 a quart. Unfortunately, I'd already thrown away the box and can't find (yet) the paperwork it came with. I'd been so pleased with their skillets, I figured their ice cream maker would be good too. NOPE. I was able to turn out a decent 2nd batch by scrapping the frozen bowl with a butter knife and spatula for 30 minutes. NOT willing to continue that method though.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small-batch, house-made!
customer_reviews.text: You don't have to leave home and pay high prices anymore for small-batch, house-made ice cream. I've been having such fun coming up with new frozen dessert combinations. I can control my ingredients, or in the parlance of the expensive restaurants, "source the ingredients".
customer_reviews.author: Angela K. Durden

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: You put 5 cups of product in, and you are lucky to get 2 cups of ice cream, this is because about 3 cups of the ice cream sticks to the walls of the pot. Takes a hammer and chisel to get it off. After around 6 uses, I threw the entire unit in the trash and will look elsewhere for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: The ice cream maker worked great!! We used the basic vanilla ice cream recipe that came with the machine and it was delicious! The consistency was perfect and all of our family enjoyed it. You do have to plan a bit ahead to make sure the bowl is frozen (24 hours in advance), but we've been storing it in our chest freezer and it's worked well. Can't wait to make more flavors!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin McLamb

product_meta.title: Cuisinart ICE-21PK Frozen Yogurt - Ice Cream & Sorbet Maker, Pink
product_meta.description: Color:PinkThe Cuisinart ICE-21PK automatic frozen yogurt-ice cream & sorbet maker in Red allows you to enjoy the finest homemade frozen treats - at home! the fully automatic Cuisinart frozen yogurt - ice cream & sorbet maker lets you make your favorites in 20 minutes or less, with no fuss and no mess. Just add ingredients to the bowl, press on and the machine does the rest!
feature_bullets: This year, Cuisinart is donating $32,500, regardless of sales, to the Breast Cancer Research Foundation.
New patent-pending mixing paddle makes frozen treats in 20 minutes or less
Large capacity – makes up to 1½ quarts
Double-insulated freezer bowl eliminates the need for ice
Easy-lock lid with large spout makes adding ingredients simple and mess free

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars8,581 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
